popt4jlib.neural

Class OptFFNNRun

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.neural.OptFFNNRun

  • public class OptFFNNRun
extends java.lang.Object
    Test-driver program for optimizing feed-forward neural networks via ANY of the meta-heuristic optimizers available in this library. Post-processing local optimization is possible via the optional "opt.localoptimizer" parameter. Notes:
    • 2020-07-22: the wrapper function in the minimize(f) main method will not create a popt4jlib.FunctionBase to pass to the minimizer, but passes the function f directly.
    • 2020-08-06: added functionality to measure validation accuracy of the resulting trained network, and to write the final weights to output file.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2020

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        run as java -cp <classpath> popt4jlib.neural.OptFFNNRun <params_file> [random_seed] [maxfuncevalslimit] . The params_file must contain lines that can be parsed by the utility method utils.DataMgr.readPropsFromFile(params_file) that will be understood by the optimizer specified in a particular line of the form:
        • class,ffnn.mainoptimizer, <fullclassnameoffunction> mandatory, the name of the java class defining the optimizer to use; example name: "popt4jlib.GA.DGA".

        There are also a number of other lines specifying mandatory key,value pairs, in addition to what is required by the used classes themselves: one line must specify a key-value pair of the form: <"opt.function", popt4jlib.neural.FFNN4Train[B] func> which denotes the actual function to optimize.

        • If two lines of the form: matrix[N01],ffnn.valdata,<filename> and dblarray,ffnn.vallabels, <filename> exist in the params file then the corresponding files will be read and used as validation data at the end of the run.
        • If in addition, there exists a line of the form class,ffnn.validationcostfunction,<fullclassname>[,ctoragruments] then the particular cost function (that must implement the FunctionIntf will be used to measure network validation cost.
        • Further, if a key-value pair of the form: <"ffnn.outputweightsfile",<filename>> is in the parameters that file will be used to write the weights of the neural net in a text file.
        • Also notice that in case the optimizer chosen is capable of using a cluster of machines to distribute the function evaluations (e.g. DGA, DPSO etc.), then an appropriate line specifying the initialization cmd for each of the workers in the cluster must be specified, e.g. "class,dga.pdbtexecinitedwrkcmd, popt4jlib.neural.FFNN4TrainEvalPDBTExecInitCmd, testdata/traindata1.dat,testdata/trainlabels1.dat". In such a case, instead of having lines such as those below in the params file: 
           # train data:
 matrix,ffnn.traindata,testdata/traindata1.dat
 # train labels
 dblarray,ffnn.trainlabels,testdata/trainlabels1.dat
          the params file should ONLY have the following two lines: 
           ffnn.traindatafile,testdata/traindata1.dat
 ffnn.trainlabelsfile,testdata/trainlabels1.dat
          which will NOT cause the parameters to contain the actual matrix and labels data.

        The optional second argument, if present, overrides the initial random seed specified in the params_file.

        The optional third argument, if present, overrides any max. limit set on the number of function evaluations allowed. After this limit, the function will always return Double.MAX_VALUE instead, and won't increase the evaluation count.

        Parameters:
        args - String[]
